definition: A disorder characterized by a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.

grades.1: Hemoglobin (Hgb) <LLN - 10.0 g/dL; <LLN - 6.2 mmol/L; <LLN - 100 g/L
grades.3: Hgb <8.0 g/dL; <4.9 mmol/L; <80 g/L; transfusion indicated

term: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.

grades.1: Mildly hypocellular or <=25% reduction from normal cellularity for age
grades.2: Moderately hypocellular or >25 - <50% reduction from normal cellularity for age
grades.3: Severely hypocellular or >50 - <=75% reduction cellularity from normal for age
grades.4: Aplastic persistent for longer than 2 weeks

definition: A disorder characterized by systemic pathological activation of blood clotting mechanisms which results in clot formation throughout the body. There is an increase in the risk of hemorrhage as the body is depleted of platelets and coagulation factors.

grades.2: Laboratory findings with no bleeding
grades.3: Laboratory findings and bleeding

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of eosinophils in the blood.

grades.1: >ULN and >Baseline
grades.3: Steroids initiated

definition: A disorder characterized by an ANC <1000/mm3 and a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour

grades.3: ANC <1000/mm3 with a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate widespread erythrocyte cell membrane destruction.

grades.1: Laboratory evidence of hemolysis only (e.g., direct antiglobulin test; DAT; Coombs'; schistocytes; decreased haptoglobin)
grades.2: Evidence of hemolysis and >=2 g decrease in hemoglobin
grades.3: Transfusion or medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)

definition: A disorder characterized by a form of thrombotic microangiopathy with renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and severe thrombocytopenia.

grades.3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of white blood cells in the blood.

grades.4: Clinical manifestations of leucostasis; urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in a lymph node.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate increased methemoglobin in the blood.

grades.2: >ULN
grades.3: Requiring urgent intervention

definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenic purpura, fever, renal abnormalities and neurological abnormalities such as seizures, hemiplegia, and visual disturbances. It is an acute or subacute condition.

grades.3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in aortic valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without cardiac electrical activity. Typically, this is accompanied by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

grades.1: Periods of asystole; non-urgent medical management indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible P waves and an irregular ventricular response due to multiple reentry circuits. The rhythm disturbance originates above the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation; new onset
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with organized rhythmic atrial contractions with a rate of 200-300 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with complete failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the AV node to the ventricles.

grades.2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a delay in the time required for the conduction of an electrical impulse through the atrioventricular (AV) node beyond 0.2 seconds; prolongation of the PR interval greater than 200 milliseconds.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by substernal discomfort due to insufficient myocardial oxygenation e.g., angina pectoris.
notes: Also consider Cardiac disorders: Myocardial infarction.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; pain on exertion; limiting instrumental ADL; hemodynamically stable
grades.3: Pain at rest; limiting self care ADL; cardiac catheterization; new onset cardiac chest pain; unstable angina

definition: A disorder characterized by pathological irregularities in the cardiac conduction system.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a bluish discoloration of the skin and/or mucous membranes.

grades.2: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the heart to pump blood at an adequate volume to meet tissue metabolic requirements, or, the ability to do so only at an elevation in the filling pressure.
notes: If left sided use Cardiac disorders: Left ventricular systolic dysfunction; also consider Cardiac disorders: Restrictive cardiomyopathy, Investigations: Ejection fraction decreased.

grades.1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
grades.2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
grades.3: Symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; hospitalization; new onset of symptoms
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)

definition: A disorder characterized by failure of the left ventricle to produce adequate output.
notes: Also consider Investigations: Ejection fraction decreased.

grades.3: Symptomatic due to drop in ejection fraction responsive to intervention
grades.4: Refractory or poorly controlled heart failure due to drop in ejection fraction; intervention such as ventricular assist device, intravenous vasopressor support, or heart transplant indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in mitral valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a progressively lengthening PR interval prior to the blocking of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker)

definition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

grades.2: Asymptomatic and cardiac enzymes minimally abnormal and no evidence of ischemic ECG changes
grades.3: Severe symptoms; cardiac enzymes abnormal; hemodynamically stable; ECG changes consistent with infarction

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the muscle tissue of the heart.

grades.2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
grades.3: Severe with symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; intervention indicated; new onset of symptoms
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)

definition: A disorder characterized by an unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with abrupt onset and sudden termination of atrial contractions with a rate of 150-250 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; ablation
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; incompletely controlled medically; cardioversion indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.

grades.2: Asymptomatic effusion size small to moderate
grades.3: Effusion with physiologic consequences

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium.
A disorder characterized by irritation to the layers of the pericardium (the protective sac around the heart).

grades.1: Asymptomatic, ECG or physical findings (e.g., rub) consistent with pericarditis
grades.2: Symptomatic pericarditis (e.g., chest pain)
grades.3: Pericarditis with physiologic consequences (e.g., pericardial constriction)

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by an inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and loses its flexibility.

grades.1: Imaging findings only
grades.2: Symptomatic without signs of heart failure
grades.3: Symptomatic heart failure or other cardiac symptoms, responsive to intervention; new onset of symptoms
grades.4: Refractory heart failure or other poorly controlled cardiac symptoms

definition: A disorder characterized by impairment of right ventricular function associated with low ejection fraction and a decrease in motility of the right ventricular wall.

grades.1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
grades.2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
grades.3: Severe symptoms, associated with hypoxia, right heart failure; oxygen indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., ventricular assist device); heart transplant indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with alternating periods of bradycardia and atrial tachycardia accompanied by syncope, fatigue and dizziness.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
grades.3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate less than 60 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
grades.3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Urgent medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates above the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in tricuspid valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible QRS complexes due to rapid repetitive excitation of myocardial fibers without coordinated contraction of the ventricles.
A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates distal to the bundle of His.

grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated

term: Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

term: Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the ear.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the external ear region.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to ear structures.

grades.4:
Adults: Decrease in hearing to profound bilateral loss (absolute threshold >80 dB HL at 2 kHz and above); nonservicable hearing

Pediatric: Audiologic indication for cochlear implant; > 40 dB HL (i.e., 45 dB HL or more); SNHL at 2 kHz and above

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation (physiologic response to irritation), swelling and redness to the middle ear.

grades.1: Serous otitis
grades.2: Serous otitis, medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Mastoiditis; necrosis of canal soft tissue or bone

definition: A disorder characterized by noise in the ears, such as ringing, buzzing, roaring or clicking.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo).

grades.1: Mild symptoms
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.

grades.2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by the adrenal cortex not producing enough of the hormone cortisol and in some cases, the hormone aldosterone. It may be due to a disorder of the adrenal cortex as in Addison's disease or primary adrenal insufficiency.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by signs and symptoms that resemble Cushing's disease or syndrome: buffalo hump obesity, striations, adiposity, hypertension, diabetes, and osteoporosis, usually due to exogenous corticosteroids.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention or hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by unusually late sexual maturity.

grades.2: No breast development by age 13 yrs for females; testes volume of <3 cc or no Tanner Stage 2 development by age 14.5 yrs for males
grades.3: No breast development by age 14 yrs for females; no increase in testes volume or no Tanner Stage 2 by age 16 yrs for males; hormone replacement indicated

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by greater growth than expected for age.

grades.2: >= +2 SD (standard deviation) above mid parental height or target height

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands. This results in hypercalcemia (abnormally high levels of calcium in the blood).

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive levels of thyroid hormone in the body. Common causes include an overactive thyroid gland or thyroid hormone overdose.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; thyroid suppression therapy indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention or hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation and cellular infiltration of the pituitary gland.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of hormones from the pituitary gland.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of thyroid hormone by the thyroid gland.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; thyroid replacement indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by unusually early development of secondary sexual features; the onset of sexual maturation begins usually before age 8 for girls and before age 9 for boys.

grades.1: Physical signs of puberty with no biochemical markers for females <8 years and males <9 years
grades.2: Physical signs and biochemical markers of puberty for females <8 years and males <9 years

definition: A disorder characterized by low testosterone.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; mild symptoms with no intervention indicated
grades.2: Replacement therapy initiated

definition: A disorder characterized by inappropriate masculinization occurring in a female or prepubertal male.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by visual perception of unclear or fuzzy images.

grades.1: Intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes. This results in a decrease in visual acuity and eventual blindness if untreated.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); glare symptoms affecting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by an area of epithelial tissue loss on the surface of the cornea. It is associated with inflammatory cells in the cornea and anterior chamber.

grades.3: Corneal ulcer without perforation in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva.
notes: If corneal ulcer is present, grade under Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; symptoms relieved by lubricants
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by incomplete paralysis of an extraocular muscle.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
grades.2: Unilateral paresis without double vision
grades.3: Bilateral paresis or unilateral paresis causing double vision in peripheral gaze, but not in central gaze
grades.4: Bilateral paresis requiring head turning to see beyond central 60 degrees or double vision in central gaze

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated; no change in vision
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL; best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately sight-threatening; limiting self care ADL; decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
grades.4: Sight-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the eye.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by impaired eyelid function.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; nonoperative intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Limiting self care ADL; operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden or brief burst of light.
notes: Also consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear or Retinal detachment

grades.1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
grades.2: Limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by an individual seeing spots before their eyes. The spots are shadows of opaque cell fragments in the vitreous humor or lens.
notes: Also consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear or Retinal detachment

grades.1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
grades.2: Limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the aqueous humor outflow.

grades.1: Less than 8 mmHg of elevated intraocular pressure (EIOP); no visual field deficit
grades.2: EIOP which can be reduced to 21 mmHg or under with topical medications and no visual field deficit
grades.3: EIOP causing visual field deficits
grades.4: Visual field deficit within the central 10 degrees of the visual field in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation to the cornea of the eye.
notes: Also consider Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); corneal ulcer; limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Perforation; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to see clearly in dim light.

grades.1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the optic nerve (second cranial nerve).

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
grades.2: Moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
grades.3: Marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by swelling around the optic disc.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; no visual field deficit
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid around the orbits of the face.

grades.1: Soft or non-pitting
grades.2: Indurated or pitting edema; topical intervention indicated
grades.3: Edema associated with visual disturbance; increased intraocular pressure, glaucoma or retinal hemorrhage; optic neuritis; diuretics indicated; operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by fear and avoidance of light.

grades.1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
grades.2: Limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by the separation of the inner retina layers from the underlying pigment epithelium.

grades.3: Macular sparing rhegmatogenous detachment

definition: A disorder characterized by a small laceration of the retina, this occurs when the vitreous separates from the retina. Symptoms include flashes and floaters.
notes: If retinal detachment is present, grade under Eye disorders: Retinal detachment

grades.1: No retinal detachment and treatment not indicated
grades.2: No retinal detachment and treatment indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by pathological retinal blood vessels that adversely affects vision.
notes: If vitreous hemorrhage is present, report under Eye disorders: Vitreous hemorrhage.

grades.2: Retinal vascular disorder without neovascularization
grades.3: Retinal vascular disorder with neovascularization

definition: A disorder involving the retina.
notes: If vitreous hemorrhage is present, report under Eye disorders: Vitreous hemorrhage.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the sclera of the eye.

grades.1: No change in vision from baseline
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation to the uvea of the eye.

grades.1: Anterior uveitis with trace cells
grades.2: Anterior uveitis with 1+ or 2+ cells
grades.3: Anterior uveitis with 3+ or greater cells; intermediate posterior or pan-uveitis
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in visual acuity.
notes: If etiology is known, use a more specific CTCAE term.

grades.3: Marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding into the vitreous humor.

grades.1: Intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive tearing in the eyes; it can be caused by overproduction of tears or impaired drainage of the tear duct.

grades.1: Intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
grades.3: Marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by an eruption consisting of papules (a small, raised pimple) and pustules (a small pus filled blister), typically appearing in face, scalp, and upper chest and back. Unlike acne, this rash does not present with whiteheads or blackheads, and can be symptomatic, with itchy or tender lesions.

grades.1: Papules and/or pustules covering <10% BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness
grades.2: Papules and/or pustules covering 10-30% BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness; associated with psychosocial impact; limiting instrumental ADL; papules and/or pustules covering > 30% BSA with or without mild symptoms

grades.2: Moderate pain; altered oral intake; non-narcotics initiated; topical analgesics initiated
grades.3: Severe pain; severely altered eating/swallowing; narcotics initiated; requires parenteral nutrition

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the pharynx and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the pharynx.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; intervention indicated
grades.3: Transfusion indicated; invasive intervention indicated; hospitalization
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by ulceration or inflammation involving the mucous membrane of the pharynx.

grades.1: Endoscopic findings only; minimal symptoms with normal oral intake; mild pain but analgesics not indicated
grades.2: Moderate pain, analgesics indicated; altered oral intake; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; unable to adequately aliment or hydrate orally; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a necrotic process occurring in the pharynx.

grades.3: Inability to aliment adequately by GI tract; invasive intervention indicated; tube feeding or TPN indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a narrowing of the pharyngeal airway.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., noisy airway breathing), no respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids); limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Limiting self care ADL; stridor; endoscopic intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser)
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the pharyngolaryngeal region.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough and marked chest discomfort.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; intervention indicated (e.g., diuretics or therapeutic thoracentesis)
grades.3: Symptomatic with respiratory distress and hypoxia; operative intervention including chest tube or pleurodesis indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the pleural cavity.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; mild hemorrhage confirmed by thoracentesis
grades.2: Symptomatic or associated with pneumothorax; chest tube drainage indicated
grades.3: >1000 ml of blood evacuated; persistent bleeding (150-200 ml/hr for 2 - 4 hr); persistent transfusion indicated; elective operative intervention indicated; hospitalization
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the pleura.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; oxygen indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by abnormal presence of air in the pleural cavity resulting in the collapse of the lung.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; intervention indicated
grades.3: Sclerosis and/or operative intervention indicated; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive mucous secretion in the back of the nasal cavity or throat, causing sore throat and/or coughing.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by expectorated secretions upon coughing.

grades.1: Occasional/minimal production of sputum with cough
grades.2: Moderate sputum production; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Persistent or copious production of sputum; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by accumulation of fluid in the lung tissues that causes a disturbance of the gas exchange that may lead to respiratory failure.

grades.1: Radiologic findings only; minimal dyspnea on exertion
grades.2: Moderate dyspnea on exertion; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe dyspnea or dyspnea at rest; oxygen indicated; limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory compromise; urgent intervention or intubation with ventilatory support indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by the replacement of the lung tissue by connective tissue, leading to progressive dyspnea, respiratory failure or right heart failure.

grades.1: Radiologic pulmonary fibrosis <25% of lung volume associated with hypoxia
grades.2: Evidence of pulmonary hypertension; radiographic pulmonary fibrosis 25 - 50% associated with hypoxia
grades.3: Severe hypoxia; evidence of right-sided heart failure; radiographic pulmonary fibrosis >50 - 75%
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences (e.g., hemodynamic/pulmonary complications); intubation with ventilatory support indicated; radiographic pulmonary fibrosis >75% with severe honeycombing

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the lung and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure within the pulmonary circulation due to lung or heart disorder.

grades.1: Minimal dyspnea; findings on physical exam or other evaluation
grades.2: Moderate dyspnea, cough; requiring evaluation by cardiac catheterization and medical intervention
grades.3: Severe symptoms, associated with hypoxia, right heart failure; oxygen indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening airway consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by impaired gas exchange by the respiratory system resulting in hypoxia and a decrease in oxygenation of the tissues that may be associated with an increase in arterial levels of carbon dioxide.

grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention, intubation, or ventilatory support indicated

term: Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by weight gain, dyspnea, pleural and pericardial effusions, leukocytosis and/or renal failure originally described in patients treated with all-trans retinoic acid.

grades.1: Fluid retention; <3 kg of weight gain; intervention with fluid restriction and/or diuretics indicated
grades.2: Moderate signs or symptoms; steroids indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive mucous secretions draining from the nose.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the paranasal sinuses.

grades.1: Asymptomatic mucosal crusting; blood-tinged secretions
grades.2: Symptomatic stenosis or edema/narrowing interfering with airflow; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Stenosis with significant nasal obstruction; limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Necrosis of soft tissue or bone; urgent operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the face, between the eyes, or upper teeth originating from the sinuses.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by cessation of breathing for short periods during sleep.

grades.1: Snoring and nocturnal sleep arousal without apneic periods
grades.2: Moderate apnea and oxygen desaturation; excessive daytime sleepiness; medical evaluation indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Oxygen desaturation; associated with pulmonary hypertension; medical intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Cardiovascular or neuropsychiatric symptoms; urgent operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by the involuntary expulsion of air from the nose.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by marked discomfort in the throat

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL; limiting ability to swallow

definition: A disorder characterized by a high pitched breathing sound due to laryngeal or upper airway obstruction.

grades.3: Respiratory distress limiting self care ADL; medical intervention indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the trachea and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an inflammation or ulceration involving the mucous membrane of the trachea.

grades.1: Endoscopic findings only; minimal hemoptysis, pain, or respiratory symptoms
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; hemorrhage or respiratory symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a narrowing of the trachea.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., noisy airway breathing), no respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids); limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Stridor or respiratory distress limiting self care ADL; invasive intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser)
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the sound and/or speed of the voice.

grades.1: Mild or intermittent change from normal voice
grades.2: Moderate or persistent change from normal voice; still understandable
grades.3: Severe voice changes including predominantly whispered speech; may require frequent repetition or face-to-face contact for understandability; may require assistive technology

definition: A disorder characterized by a high-pitched, whistling sound during breathing. It results from the narrowing or obstruction of the respiratory airways.

grades.1: Detectable airway noise with minimal symptoms
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe respiratory symptoms limiting self care ADL; oxygen therapy or hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in density of hair compared to normal for a given individual at a given age and body location.

grades.1: Hair loss of <50% of normal for that individual that is not obvious from a distance but only on close inspection; a different hair style may be required to cover the hair loss but it does not require a wig or hair piece to camouflage
grades.2: Hair loss of >=50% normal for that individual that is readily apparent to others; a wig or hair piece is necessary if the patient desires to completely camouflage the hair loss; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal body smell resulting from the growth of bacteria on the body.

grades.1: Mild odor; physician intervention not indicated; self care interventions
grades.2: Pronounced odor; psychosocial impact; patient seeks medical intervention

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the skin characterized by the presence of bullae which are filled with fluid.
notes: If infectious, consider Infections and infestations: Rash pustular or other site-specific Infections and infestations term.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; blisters covering <10% BSA
grades.2: Blisters covering 10 - 30% BSA; painful blisters; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Blisters covering >30% BSA; limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Blisters covering >30% BSA; associated with fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by flaky and dull skin; the pores are generally fine, the texture is a papery thin texture.

grades.1: Covering <10% BSA and no associated erythema or pruritus
grades.2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated with erythema or pruritus; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Covering >30% BSA and associated with pruritus; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by skin which becomes itchy, red, inflamed, crusty, thick, scaly, and/or forms blisters.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms;additional medical intervention over baseline not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; topical or oral intervention indicated; additional medical intervention over baseline indicated
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; IV intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by target lesions (a pink-red ring around a pale center).

grades.1: Target lesions covering <10% BSA and not associated with skin tenderness
grades.2: Target lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated with skin tenderness
grades.3: Target lesions covering >30% BSA and associated with oral or genital erosions
grades.4: Target lesions covering >30% BSA; associated with fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by generalized inflammatory erythema and exfoliation. The inflammatory process involves > 90% of the body surface area.

grades.2: Erythema covering >90% BSA without associated symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Erythema covering >90% BSA with associated symptoms (e.g., pruritus or tenderness); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Erythema covering >90% BSA with associated fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by shrinking of adipose tissue.

grades.1: Covering <10% BSA and asymptomatic
grades.2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated with erythema or tenderness; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Covering >30% BSA; associated with erythema or tenderness; limiting self-care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by change in hair color or loss of normal pigmentation.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the way the hair feels.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of excess hair growth in women in anatomic sites where growth is considered to be a secondary male characteristic and under androgen control (beard, moustache, chest, abdomen).

grades.1: In women, increase in length, thickness or density of hair in a male distribution that the patient is able to camouflage by periodic shaving, bleaching, or removal of hair
grades.2: In women, increase in length, thickness or density of hair in a male distribution that requires daily shaving or consistent destructive means of hair removal to camouflage; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive sweating.
notes: Synonym: Night sweats, diaphoresis

grades.1: Limited to one site (palms, soles, or axillae); self care interventions
grades.2: Involving >1 site; patient seeks medical intervention; associated with psychosocial impact
grades.3: Associated with electrolyte/hemodynamic imbalance

definition: A disorder characterized by a thickening of the outer layer of the skin.

grades.1: Present
grades.3: Limiting self-care ADLs

definition: A disorder characterized by hair density or length beyond the accepted limits of normal in a particular body region, for a particular age or race.

grades.1: Increase in length, thickness or density of hair that the patient is either able to camouflage by periodic shaving or removal of hairs or is not concerned enough about the overgrowth to use any form of hair removal
grades.2: Increase in length, thickness or density of hair at least on the usual exposed areas of the body [face (not limited to beard/moustache area) plus/minus arms] that requires frequent shaving or use of destructive means of hair removal to camouflage; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by reduced sweating.

grades.2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Increase in body temperature; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by hypertrophy of the subcutaneous adipose tissue at the site of multiple subcutaneous injections of insulin.

grades.1: Asymptomatic and covering <10% BSA
grades.2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated tenderness; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Covering >30% BSA and associated tenderness and narcotics or NSAIDs indicated; lipohypertrophy; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the nails.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the color of the nail plate.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only

definition: A disorder characterized by loss of all or a portion of the nail.

grades.1: Asymptomatic separation of the nail bed from the nail plate or nail loss
grades.2: Symptomatic separation of the nail bed from the nail plate or nail loss; limiting instrumental ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by vertical or horizontal ridges on the nails.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the skin.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by redness, marked discomfort, swelling, and tingling in the palms of the hands or the soles of the feet. Also known as Hand-Foot Syndrome.

grades.1: Minimal skin changes or dermatitis (e.g., erythema, edema, or hyperkeratosis) without pain
grades.2: Skin changes (e.g., peeling, blisters, bleeding, fissures, edema, or hyperkeratosis) with pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe skin changes (e.g., peeling, blisters, bleeding, fissures, edema, or hyperkeratosis) with pain; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in sensitivity of the skin to light.

grades.1: Painless erythema and erythema covering <10% BSA
grades.2: Tender erythema covering 10 - 30% BSA
grades.3: Erythema covering >30% BSA and erythema with blistering; photosensitivity; oral corticosteroid therapy indicated; pain control indicated (e.g., narcotics or NSAIDs)

definition: A disorder characterized by an intense itching sensation.

grades.1: Mild or localized; topical intervention indicated
grades.2: Widespread and intermittent; skin changes from scratching (e.g., edema, papulation, excoriations, lichenification, oozing/crusts); oral intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Widespread and constant; limiting self care ADL or sleep; systemic corticosteroid or immunosuppressive therapy indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by hemorrhagic areas of the skin and mucous membrane. Newer lesions appear reddish in color. Older lesions are usually a darker purple color and eventually become a brownish-yellow color.

grades.1: Combined area of lesions covering <10% BSA
grades.2: Combined area of lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA; bleeding with trauma
grades.3: Combined area of lesions covering >30% BSA; spontaneous bleeding

definition: A disorder characterized by an eruption of papules and pustules, typically appearing in face, scalp, upper chest and back.

grades.1: Papules and/or pustules covering <10% BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness
grades.2: Papules and/or pustules covering 10 - 30% BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness; associated with psychosocial impact; limiting instrumental ADL; papules and/or pustules covering > 30% BSA with or without mild symptoms
grades.3: Papules and/or pustules covering >30% BSA with moderate or severe symptoms; limiting self-care ADL; associated with local superinfection with oral antibiotics indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; papules and/or pustules covering any % BSA, which may or may not be associated with symptoms of pruritus or tenderness and are associated with extensive superinfection with IV antibiotics indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of macules (flat) and papules (elevated). Also known as morbillform rash, it is one of the most common cutaneous adverse events, frequently affecting the upper trunk, spreading centripetally and associated with pruritis.

grades.1: Macules/papules covering <10% BSA with or without symptoms (e.g., pruritus, burning, tightness)
grades.2: Macules/papules covering 10 - 30% BSA with or without symptoms (e.g., pruritus, burning, tightness); limiting instrumental ADL; rash covering > 30% BSA with or without mild symptoms
grades.3: Macules/papules covering >30% BSA with moderate or severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the skin covering the top and the back of the head.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

term: Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by the degeneration and thinning of the epidermis and dermis.

grades.1: Covering <10% BSA; associated with telangiectasias or changes in skin color
grades.2: Covering 10 - 30% BSA; associated with striae or adnexal structure loss
grades.3: Covering >30% BSA; associated with ulceration

definition: A disorder characterized by darkening of the skin due to excessive melanin deposition.

grades.1: Hyperpigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
grades.2: Hyperpigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by loss of skin pigment (e.g., vitiligo).

grades.1: Hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
grades.2: Hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by an area of hardness in the skin.

grades.1: Mild induration, able to move skin parallel to plane (sliding) and perpendicular to skin (pinching up)
grades.2: Moderate induration, able to slide skin, unable to pinch skin; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe induration; unable to slide or pinch skin; limiting joint or orifice movement (e.g., mouth, anus); limiting self care ADL
grades.4: Generalized; associated with signs or symptoms of impaired breathing or feeding

definition: A disorder characterized by a circumscribed, erosive lesion on the skin.

grades.1: Combined area of ulcers <1 cm; nonblanchable erythema of intact skin with associated warmth or edema
grades.2: Combined area of ulcers 1 - 2 cm; partial thickness skin loss involving skin or subcutaneous fat
grades.3: Combined area of ulcers >2 cm; full-thickness skin loss involving damage to or necrosis of subcutaneous tissue that may extend down to fascia
grades.4: Any size ulcer with extensive destruction, tissue necrosis, or damage to muscle, bone, or supporting structures with or without full thickness skin loss

definition: A disorder characterized by less than 10% total body skin area separation of dermis. The syndrome is thought to be a hypersensitivity complex affecting the skin and the mucous membranes.

grades.3: Skin sloughing covering <10% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment, and mucous membrane detachment)
grades.4: Skin sloughing covering 10 - 30% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment and mucous membrane detachment)

definition: A disorder characterized by air in the subcutaneous tissue.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by local dilatation of small vessels resulting in red discoloration of the skin or mucous membranes.

grades.1: Telangiectasias covering <10% BSA
grades.2: Telangiectasias covering >=10% BSA; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by greater than 30% total body skin area separation of dermis. The syndrome is thought to be a hypersensitivity complex affecting the skin and the mucous membranes.

grades.4: Skin sloughing covering >=30% BSA with associated symptoms (e.g., erythema, purpura, or epidermal detachment)

definition: A disorder characterized by an itchy skin eruption characterized by wheals with pale interiors and well-defined red margins.

grades.1: Urticarial lesions covering <10% BSA; topical intervention indicated
grades.2: Urticarial lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA; oral intervention indicated
grades.3: Urticarial lesions covering >30% BSA; IV intervention indicated

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

term: Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by occlusion of an arterial vessel by a blood clot that develops in an artery.
notes: Consider Nervous system disorders: TIA or Stroke for CNS-related events or Cardiac disorders: Myocardial infarction

grades.3: Urgent intervention indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; hemodynamic or neurologic instability; organ damage; loss of extremity(ies)

definition: A disorder characterized by leakage of intravascular fluids into the extravascular space. This syndrome is observed in patients who demonstrate a state of generalized leaky capillaries following shock syndromes, low-flow states, ischemia-reperfusion injuries, toxemias, medications, or poisoning. It can lead to generalized edema and multiple organ failure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by episodic reddening of the skin, especially face, neck, or chest.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Symptomatic, associated with hypotension and/or tachycardia; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a localized collection of blood, usually clotted, in an organ, space, or tissue, due to a break in the wall of a blood vessel.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Minimally invasive evacuation or aspiration indicated
grades.3: Transfusion; invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an uncomfortable and temporary sensation of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating upon cooling.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a pathological increase in blood pressure.

grades.3:
Adult: Systolic BP >=160 mm Hg or diastolic BP >=100 mm Hg; medical intervention indicated; more than one drug or more intensive therapy than previously used indicated;

Pediatric and adolescent: Systolic and/or diastolic > 5 mmHg above the 99th percentile
grades.4: Adult and Pediatric: Life-threatening consequences (e.g., malignant hypertension, transient or permanent neurologic deficit, hypertensive crisis); urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a blood pressure that is below the normal expected for an individual in a given environment.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Medical intervention indicated; hospitalization indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences and urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by the loss of lymph fluid into the surrounding tissue or body cavity.

grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive fluid collection in tissues that causes swelling.

grades.1: Trace thickening or faint discoloration
grades.2: Marked discoloration; leathery skin texture; papillary formation; limiting instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by a cystic lesion containing lymph.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by impaired circulation to an extremity.

grades.2: Brief (<24 hrs) episode of ischemia managed medically and without permanent deficit
grades.3: Prolonged (>=24 hrs) or recurring symptoms and/or invasive intervention indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; evidence of end organ damage; urgent operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the wall of a vein.

grades.2: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by a blood clot and inflammation involving a superficial vein of the extremities.

grades.2: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by obstruction of the blood flow in the superior vena cava. Signs and symptoms include swelling and cyanosis of the face, neck, and upper arms, cough, orthopnea and headache.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; incidental finding of SVC thrombosis
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated (e.g., anticoagulation, radiation or chemotherapy)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; multi-modality intervention indicated (e.g., anticoagulation, chemotherapy, radiation, stenting)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent multi-modality intervention indicated (e.g., lysis, thrombectomy, surgery)

definition: A disorder characterized by occlusion of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.
notes: Consider Nervous system disorders: TIA or Stroke for CNS-related events. Use Vascular disorders: Arterial thromboembolism for arterial thrombi.

grades.1: Medical intervention not indicated (e.g., superficial thrombosis)
grades.2: Medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Urgent medical intervention indicated (e.g., pulmonary embolism or intracardiac thrombus)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences with hemodynamic or neurologic instability

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving the wall of a vessel.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms, medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; evidence of peripheral or visceral ischemia; urgent intervention indicated
